website_summaries.verdict: This DOP-certified balsamic vinegar from Modena, Italy is top-tier quality.
pros: Aged for 25 years, this is some of the best balsamic vinegar on the market
Users like its thick consistency and woody aroma
Just a few drops adds a ton of flavor

customer_reviews.title: Great aged vinegar.
customer_reviews.text: Great vinegar though i believe my shipment stated that the product was "at least 12 years old" and not 25 as advertised. No matter, still tasted great! Loved it on ice cream and salad as well as on tuna and salmon --- sweet/tart ratio is very good (the older products tend to be sweeter in my limited experience so perhaps the 12 year ageing is better for what we use it for). Value seemed good as compared with my local boutiques which sell higher end vinegar (can't find this stuff in your local grocery generally).
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: wonderful
customer_reviews.text: I purchased both the 12 and 25 year old DOP certified balsamic vinegar. They both are excellent and I am happy with each. The 25 year old is slightly thicker. I could drink both accept for the cost. I use the 12 year old in small salads but I save the 25 year old for my home made humus. They last me a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Lucinda Silloway

customer_reviews.title: The real deal. Worth every penny.
customer_reviews.text: This is the real thing. It's worth the money if you use it where it is front and center. Consider freshly grilled beef, or grana cheese with this Balsamic drizzled over the pieces paired with a nice Montepulcano d'Abruzzo. Fresh Strawberries are perfect, too.
customer_reviews.author: Former Rater

customer_reviews.title: Delicious!!
customer_reviews.text: This is the real stuff. More woody tasting than I expected but still delicious. Don't waste its syrupy goodness on a salad. At $8 per teaspoon this stuff is to be sparingly dripped over a main meat course or served with strawberries for a decadent dessert. Don't confuse this with the balsamic vinegar sold in grocery stores. This is aged and concentrated in wood barrels for decades so it is thick as syrup and has a wonderful sweet/sour/woody taste. Read the description carefully so you won't be surprised at how small the bottle of this precious elixir is.
customer_reviews.author: ParrotPilot

customer_reviews.title: Unbelievable
customer_reviews.text: Forget everything you thought you knew about Balsamic Vinegar and try this. Prices go up from this to some that must be unbelievable, but this is some of the best we've tried in years.
customer_reviews.author: G-Man

customer_reviews.title: A taste of Rome here at home!
customer_reviews.text: During a vacation in Rome my husband and I went on a food tour... they had this vinegar at one of the stops and we were hooked! I got this for my husband for his birthday and he was thrilled! Well worth the price ! A little drop is all you need! Thank you for offering it here on Amazon! Love it!!
customer_reviews.author: C. Peters

customer_reviews.title: Yummy!!
customer_reviews.text: Delicious! If I could I would use this stuff every day. It is way too expensive for me, so I got it one time as a special treat but enjoyed every drop.
customer_reviews.author: marie

customer_reviews.title: Don’t hesitate to purchase this!
customer_reviews.text: Words can not express the wonder of this balsamic vinegar. It is the best taste ever. A hint of sweetness and other wonderful tastes. Well worth the breathtaking price.
customer_reviews.author: LH

customer_reviews.title: Great vinegar but very expensive.
customer_reviews.text: I thought it was expensive when I ordered it. It turned out to be even more expensive per ounce than I realized. When it arrived I was surprised at how small the bottle was.
customer_reviews.author: Gordon

customer_reviews.title: Great Balsamic at an Excellent Promotional Price
customer_reviews.text: This stuff is awesome! We've had other moderately-expensive balsamic vinegars that are not in the certified container and didn't know what we were missing. Purchased this with a promotional price that couldn't be beat.
customer_reviews.author: cs

customer_reviews.title: Pamper yourself and try this balsamic.
customer_reviews.text: Very excellent balsamic vinegar. Gave one to my brother and the other to my wife. You need to try this one for yourself!
customer_reviews.author: Skipper

customer_reviews.title: Bought this as a gift.
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this for a gift. Had brought 25 year old vinegar home from Italy for myself, knew a good cook would appreciate it. Worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: Cathy Elliott

customer_reviews.title: I'm not a connoisseur but know the difference from good and mediocre and this is very good
customer_reviews.text: Very tasty balsamic! I'm not a connoisseur but know the difference from good and mediocre and this is very good. At this price, we will stretch it out for special occasions, but I can say I'd buy another when it's gone.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Schulte

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: It is great to have a company that REALLY knows balsamic vinegar and has such rare choices.
customer_reviews.author: James F Miller IV

customer_reviews.title: I was amazed with it's great taste
customer_reviews.text: Having never tried traditional balsamic vinegar before, I was amazed with it's great taste! This product is very good.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: It's authentic traditional Balsamic Vinegar
customer_reviews.text: You must always check to see if the vinegar is authentic. This is delicous
customer_reviews.author: Geri Spieler

customer_reviews.title: Best on salads
customer_reviews.text: Got it for a steal! Hoping to buy again in the future
customer_reviews.author: Emilio’s Roommates

customer_reviews.title: The real deal!
customer_reviews.text: I'm new to balsamic. This balsamic is very thick. It has a strong aroma. Sweet and somewhat fruity. You don't need much. Puts store bought balsamics to shame! Expensive..but it's worth it!
customer_reviews.author: C.Dub

customer_reviews.title: Quality
customer_reviews.text: Best quality balsamic that I can find available to be shipped to the USA.
customer_reviews.author: Nykhole Marek

customer_reviews.title: Delicioso and worth every penny! Use as a finishing condiment and the bottle will last six months.
customer_reviews.text: The bottle lasts a long time. I dribble it on Caprese salads, strawberries and add a drop to shards of good Parmesan. Just a wonderful enhancement, well worth the money. Use it sparingly and it will last. Try combining it with a good olive oil, then dress a green salad with a few slices of fresh or grilled peaches. Add some Fleur de Sel crystals and a couple turns of cracked pepper, a few crumbles of goat cheese. Oh...my!
customer_reviews.author: Suzie McKay

customer_reviews.title: You can get it cheaper from other sellers
customer_reviews.text: I'm not a Balsamic Vinegar know it all but I do know I should have look a little harder to find a better deal for the about half the price. Delicious BV though.
customer_reviews.author: WRS

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it
customer_reviews.text: So much money for sow thing that I didn't that was that amazing. I found some for $13 that I liked better. Wouldn't buy again. Didn't think was special.
customer_reviews.author: Nikki

customer_reviews.title: False Advertising, Fraud products,He replaced vinegar and reglued down foil.CrIminal
customer_reviews.text: This is a fraud on the American people...He sent me a 179.00 bottle of vinegar that had the foil cut open and reglued down after replacing the very expensive vinegar with a sub standard product..........This STAIN unto humanity falsly markets "15 yo balsamic vinegar" with Amazon protecting this criminal fraud The labeling of the bottles does not support his Amazon marketing claims.......Amazon is aware......He sends out substandard adulterated products that are not what he claims the vinegar to be...Their are no D.O.P..The balsamic vinegar guy NO RETURN policy along with Amazons complicity in hiding criminal activity....IS A FRAUD ON THE AMERICAN PEOPLE.......AND A STAIN TO THE ITALIAN HERITAGE
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Visited the place where it's made--amazing taste!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this from the Acetaia di Giorgio in Modena, where it is made, and after taste-testing about five, each excellent with tastes from the type of wood used for the cask ( cherry, oak, etc ). Paid a pretty penny but this Superiore at 150E is awesome! Worth every Euro!
customer_reviews.author: Dr. K.

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny
customer_reviews.text: This is absolutely the best Balsamic I’ve ever tasted. Sweet and thick. The very best birthday gift I’ve ever received. I can’t wait to try it with some fresh tomatoes and fresh mozzarella.
customer_reviews.author: Anna Carter

customer_reviews.title: This seems very sketchy. Having been to Modena, ...
customer_reviews.text: This seems very sketchy. Having been to Modena, I know that the producers of these vinegars are very proud of their products - especially given the time needed to create the vinegar - and I wonder why they would allow another label to cover theirs? And part of the joys of these products are learning about the artisans who create them. This is lost here. I would avoid this product and buy from a seller who doesn't mask the origin of the product.
customer_reviews.author: Burp

customer_reviews.title: The Balsamic Guy is the real deal!!
customer_reviews.text: It is very difficult to come across true traditional balsamic vinegar. True aficionados know the difference when it comes to the real stuff. The Balsamic Guy delivers on all parts. Delivery time was fast and product came beautifully packaged. Makes for a great gift but I will be enjoying this balsmaic with some of my favorite cheeses and a nice glass of red wine. Thank you Balsamic Guy!
customer_reviews.author: Andy Doyle

customer_reviews.title: Terrific Product
customer_reviews.text: great packaging great product a very special balsamic thank you
customer_reviews.author: scott rowe

customer_reviews.title: Delighted with Purchase!
customer_reviews.text: First time ordering and so glad I did! Delicious taste and gorgeous packaging! Love it and plan to order again!
customer_reviews.author: Sarah H.

customer_reviews.title: Great hostess gift
customer_reviews.text: A delicious balsamic. Rich in flavor. I will definitely reorder. Great hostess gift.
customer_reviews.author: Fabioloso82

product_meta.title: Balsamic Vinegar of Modena Traditional 25 year old DOP certified. Aceto Balsamico Tradizionale Extra Vecchio from Villa Ronzan The Balsamic Guy.
product_meta.description:
Traditional Balsamic Vinegar of Modena Extra Vecchio from The Balsamic Guy 

 Experience the REAL THING! This is the best balsamic vinegar you can buy! Taste the Difference NOW 

-Are you confused about the different quality of Balsamic Vinegar available on the market? 
-Tired of false claims of aged Balsamic Vinegar that lack taste and depth? 
-Do you want a Balsamic Vinegar that is well balanced and can be paired with any type of food?  Introducing The Balsamic Guy Traditional Balsamic Vinegar from Modena. 

-In order to be bottled in the unique and legally exclusive bottle, all Traditional Balsamic Vinegar of Modena, must be assessed by a panel of five expert tasters who authorize the sale of the product only if it passes a rigorous set of tests, including visual, smell and taste standards. The affixing of a numbered seal guarantees the quality of the product contained in each individual bottle. Unlike other inexpensive balsamic vinegar available on the market, this traditional balsamic vinegar is made with nothing but cooked grape must and it is aged in wooden barrels for a minimum of 25 years. We secure the lots with the highest scoring points from the expert tasters, so not only you get real traditional balsamic vinegar, you get the best of the best Guaranteed best taste or your money back. 

- Try it risk free. If for any reason you are not 100% satisfied, we will issue a full refund. This balsamic known as Extra Vecchio is aged at least 25 years. Really aged a minimum of 25 years, unlike many false claims of vinegar aged so many years when they are only partially aged and diluted with wine vinegar. This is THE REAL THING. 
- This is really an amazing work of art by man and nature combined. You will not be disappointed. 
-Sold in an exclusive bottle, it comes with a pourer, an information and recipe book, and packed in a gift box. Order yours today for guaranteed sale price
feature_bullets: VINEGAR BALSAMIC 100 ML. THIS IS THE ONLY TYPE OF BOTTLE GUARANTEED BY THE CONSORTIUM OF TRADITIONAL BALSAMIC VINEGAR PRODUCERS IN MODENA, ITALY (Aceto Balsamico Tradizionale di Modena). If it's not in this bottle, You are not tasting authentic Traditional Balsamic Vinegar of Modena

WE ONLY IMPORT THE BEST PRODUCTS AVAILABLE. Our Balsamic Vinegar has the highest possible scoring rating available. This is the older version of Traditional Balsamic Vinegar. Known as Extra Vecchio. Aged at least a minimum of 25 years.

PERFECT FOR MANY TYPES OF FOOD. Delicious on Meat, Cheese, Fish, Salads, Fruit, Vegetables, Desserts, or enjoyed on its own. Perfect gift for any occasion: Valentine's day, Birthday, anniversary, Mother's day, Father's day, Holiday, and Christmas gift.
FULL OF ANTI OXIDANTS AND MINERALS. Low Calories, All Natural, and Plenty of Health Benefits! Perfect for Paleo diet, Atkins diet, South Beach diet, Whole 30, and more.
GUARANTEED BEST TASTING BALSAMIC VINEGAR. If you are not 100% satisfied, we provide a no hassle no question asked full refund
